intro: Guatteria caniflora var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant features broad, elliptical leaves that are glossy and dark green in color. Its flowers are small, white or pale pink, and arranged in clusters, often blooming during the wet season. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
